    Transform Regional Data

    transform_regions.Rd

    This function transforms a column in a spatial data frame based on specified groupings and replacements. It allows you to recategorize regions according to predefined groups and visualize the transformed map if desired.

    transform_regions(
  map,
  existing_column_name,
  groups,
  replacements,
  default = "OTHER",
  view_transformed_map = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    map

    A spatial data frame (e.g., an `sf` object) containing regional information.

    existing_column_name

    The name of the column in `map` that contains the regions to be transformed.

    groups

    A list where each element is a vector of regions that should be replaced with a new category.

    replacements

    A vector of replacement values corresponding to each group in `groups`. Each element in `replacements` specifies the new category for the regions listed in `groups`.

    default

    A string specifying the default category for regions not included in any of the `groups`. Default is `"OTHER"`.

    view_transformed_map

    A logical value indicating whether to visualize the transformed map using `ggplot2`. If `TRUE`, the function returns a list containing the transformed map and the plot. Default is `FALSE`.

    Value

    If `view_transformed_map` is `FALSE`, returns the modified spatial data frame with a new column containing the transformed region categories. If `view_transformed_map` is `TRUE`, returns a list with two elements: the transformed spatial data frame and a `ggplot` object visualizing the transformed map.

    Details

    The function creates a new column in the spatial data frame where each region is categorized according to the specified `groups` and `replacements`. Regions not included in any of the `groups` are assigned the `default` category. If `view_transformed_map` is `TRUE`, it uses `ggplot2` to plot the transformed data with a color scale based on the new categories.

    See also

    glue

    Examples

    if (FALSE) {
if(interactive()){
 #EXAMPLE1
 }
}
